required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single Escalating Dose and Multiple Dose Study of BAY 1093884 in Subjects With Severe Hemophilia Types A or B, With or Without Inhibitors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, First in Man, Multicenter, Open Label, Single Escalating Dose Study of BAY1093884 in Subjects With Severe Hemophilia Types A or B, With or Without Inhibitors

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of BAY1093884 after Intravenous (IV) and subcutaneous (SC) administration of increasing single doses and SC administration of multiple doses.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants (single dose cohors) with adverse events as measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events including abnormal laboratory findings and local injection site reactions

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by AUC(0-tlast)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 [pre-dose (within 1 hour), at the end of infusion or injection (=1hr), 2hrs, 4hrs, 8hrs], Days 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 21, 28, 43, and 56 (for cohorts 3, 4 and I-SC2, S-2, S-3) after the start of infusion
primary_outcome.description: AUC from time 0 to the last data point > LLOQ (lower limit of quantitation)

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by AUC(0-tlast)/D
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 [pre-dose (within 1 hour), at the end of infusion or injection (=1hr), 2hrs, 4hrs, 8hrs], Days 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 21, 28, 43, and 56 (for cohorts 3, 4 and I-SC2, S-2, S-3) after the start of infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by Cmax
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 [pre-dose (within 1 hour), at the end of infusion or injection (=1hr), 2hrs, 4hrs, 8hrs], Days 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 21, 28, 43, and 56 (for cohorts 3, 4 and I-SC2, S-2, S-3) after the start of infusion
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed drug concentration in measured matrix after single dose administration

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by Cmax/D
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 [pre-dose (within 1 hour), at the end of infusion or injection (=1hr), 2hrs, 4hrs, 8hrs], Days 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 21, 28, 43, and 56 (for cohorts 3, 4 and I-SC2, S-2, S-3) after the start of infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants (multiple dose cohort) with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events including abnormal laboratory findings and local injection site reactions

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma levels of anti-BAY1093884 antibodies (multiple dose cohort)
Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by AUC(0-7d and AUC(0-tau) (multiple dose cohort)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection, Days 1, 3, 5 and Days 7, and Day 35 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection on Day 35; Days 36, 38, 40, 42
secondary_outcome.description: AUC from time 0 to 7d after first and last dose (AUC(0-tau)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by AUC(0-7d/D and AUC(0-tau)/D after multiple dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection, Days 1, 3, 5 and Days 7, and Day 35 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection on Day 35; Days 36, 38, 40, 42
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-7d) after first dose and AUC(0-tau) after last dose divided by dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by Cmax after first dose and last dose (Cmax,md)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection, Days 1, 3, 5 and Days 7, and Day 35 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection on Day 35; Days 36, 38, 40, 42
secondary_outcome.description: maximum observed drug concentration in measured matrix after first and last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of BAY1093884 characterized by Cmax/D after first dose and last dose (Cmax,md/D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection, Days 1, 3, 5 and Days 7, and Day 35 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection on Day 35; Days 36, 38, 40, 42
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax after first and last dose divided by dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Accumulation of BAY 1093884 in plasma as defined by ratio for Cmax and AUC (after first and last dose)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection, Days 1, 3, 5 and Days 7, and Day 35 (prior to start of SC injection) and 8 hrs after start of SC injection on Day 35; Days 36, 38, 40, 42
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax after last dose divided by Cmax after first dose, AUC after last dose divided by AUC after first dose

arm_group.description: Dose escalation steps for participants without inhibitors - intravenous infusion and subcutaneous injection
Dose escalation steps for participants with inhibitors - intravenous infusion and subcutaneous injection
Multiple dose cohort for participants without inhibitors - a single subcutaneous injection once a week for 6 weeks

intervention.description: Single escalating dose with a starting dose of 0.3 mg/kg for the first cohort. Drug will be administered via IV infusion over 1 hour and SC injection. Based on safety, PK and PD results the doses for the other cohorts will be determined.
Multiple dose cohort with a single 150-mg SC injection once a week for 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males with severe congenital Hemophilia A or B defined as <1% FVIII or Factor IX (FIX) concentration by measurement at the time of screening or from reliable prior documentation
- For subjects in Cohorts I-IV, I-SC1 and I-SC2; If history of inhibitors is evident, inhibitor titer of ≥5 Bethesda Units (BU) at screening or prior to screening at any time from medical records.
- Age: 18 to 65 years of age at screening
- Body mass index (BMI): 18 to 29.9 kg/m²
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with known bleeding disorders (such as von Willebrand factor [vWF] deficiency, FXI deficiency, platelet disorders, or known acquired or inherited thrombophilia etc.) other than congenital Hemophilia A or B with or without inhibitors
- History of angina pectoris or treatment for angina pectoris
- History of coronary and/or peripheral atherosclerotic disease, congestive heart failure, disseminated intravascular coagulopathy, or stage 2 hypertension defined as systolic blood pressure (SBP) ≥160 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure (DBP) ≥100 mmHg even if controlled
- History of thrombophlebitis, venous / arterial thromboembolic diseases (particularly deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, stroke, myocardial infarction, cerebrovascular accident, ischemic heart disease, transient ischemic attack)
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity of the immune system, history of anaphylactic reaction, known (clinically relevant) allergies, non-allergic drug reactions, or multiple drug allergies
